comments.author: jonpryor@vt.edu
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

I have no idea why it's rendered incorrectly, so this may very well be a duplicate but I don't know what to search for to even find a duplicate...

http://mono-android.net/Documentation is rendered incorrectly on Firefox 4.0 on OSX, and correctly on Firefox 4.0/Windows+Linux/Firefox 3.6 OSX/Chrome/Safari.

Firefox 4.0 OSX: http://www.jprl.com/tmp/Documentation-FF4.png
Firefox 3.6 OSX: http://www.jprl.com/tmp/Documentation-FF36.png

Note that the sidebar is actually on the side on Firefox 3.6, while it's on top (and pushes all content lower on the page) on Firefox 4.0.

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: jonpryor@vt.edu

comments.author: moz.teodosia@gmail.com
comments.text:
Work for me using Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0)
Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.

Can you still reproduce this issue with a new profile?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing%20profiles
comments.creator: moz.teodosia@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Work for me using Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0)
Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.

Can you still reproduce this issue with a new profile?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing%20profiles

comments.creator: jonpryor@vt.edu
comments.author: jonpryor@vt.edu
comments.text:
Yes, creating a new profile fixes the issue.

So what's wrong with my old profile?
comments.raw_text:
Yes, creating a new profile fixes the issue.

So what's wrong with my old profile?

comments.text: Most probably, the issue was caused by an installed add-on. If you want to find which one, disable your add-ons one by one and reload the page.
comments.author: moz.teodosia@gmail.com
comments.creator: moz.teodosia@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Most probably, the issue was caused by an installed add-on. If you want to find which one, disable your add-ons one by one and reload the page.

comments.author: jonpryor@vt.edu
comments.text:
I started Firefox 4 with Safe mode, and disabled all add-ons. The problem was still present in the default profile, so I don't think it's due to an add-on.

Oh, brilliant: it's due to being logged in vs. not logged in. If I'm not logged in, FF4 displays the page properly; if I am logged in, it displays incorrectly even in my new FF4 profile.

FF3.6/Chrome/etc., meanwhile, display the page properly even when I'm logged in.

So, I do File->Save As (web page, complete) in Firefox 3.6. Output here:

    http://www.jprl.com/tmp/Documentation.html

That, too, renders properly in Chrome and Firefox 3.6, while rendering improperly in Firefox 4 (even with a new profile).
comments.creator: jonpryor@vt.edu

comments.author: leonard.camacho@gmail.com
comments.text:
With the url on comment 4 tested on Firefox 3.6.16 Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686 (x86_64); es-AR; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 the page renders properly.

Using minefield builds Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110401 Firefox/4.2a1pre and Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110401 Firefox/4.2a1pre, I can reproduce the bug the page renders improperly.
